author: Charles White
title: Teenager who tried to have sex with a dog is spared jail
text:
The teen avoided jail at the Ipswich District Court (Picture: google maps) A teenager who tried to have sex with a dog has escaped jail, because the prosecutor and judge felt sorry for him. 
The 19-year-old did not physically harm the animal but tried to ‘interfere’ with it.
This fire-spewing drone is probably nothing to worry about The teenager was apparently ‘experimenting’ and has pleaded guilty to attempted bestiality.
The boy, who cannot be named, was pitied by Crown prosecutor Amanda Robinson.
She said his actions were ‘spontaneous and opportunistic rather than predatory.’
The teen’s identity was not revealed and the full details were not allowed to be read out by the prosecution (Picture: Shutterstock) From Esk, near Brisbane in Australia, the teenager ‘recognised the wrongfulness of his conduct’ when confessing to police, Robinson said.
Adding that the revelation the 19-year-old tried to have sex with a dog was ‘likely’ to bring about public humiliation.
Caught in March 2015, the judge stopped the prosecution from describing the full extent of the incident, including the name and breed of the dog.
The boy, according to his lawyer Julian Noud, was psychologically distressed and disturbed at the time of the incident.
Woman expertly trolls Donald Trump from beyond the grave with her obituary He was facing prison time when he pleaded guilty to the offence but the judge claimed it had not reflected his ‘true character’.
Judge Alexander Horneman-Wren said: ‘You had many distressing family insults that resulted in a number of unfortunate events and one particular tragedy was used in quite a horrible way by your peers to bully you which might provide some context about how this matter came about.
‘You were the subject of quite horrible harassment.’
He was sentenced to two years probation and avoided jail.
